body_html:
I'm running into a very similar problem as reported here, where import keras_applications fails during the build of TensorFlow 1.11.0 (cfr. #21518), even though Keras-Applications is installed in a location listed in $PYTHONPATH (installed with pip install --prefix, so not in a standard location).

Testing with python -c "import keras_applications" confirms that my environment (outside of the Bazel sandbox) is correctly set up.

Like @maxnbk I have tried instructing Bazel (v0.16.0 in my case) to pass down $PYTHONPATH using --action_env=PYTHONPATH, but that doesn't fix the issue...

Any updates on this?

Testing with python -c "import keras_applications" confirms that my environment (outside of the Bazel sandbox) is correctly set up.
Like @maxnbk I have tried instructing Bazel (v0.16.0 in my case) to pass down $PYTHONPATH using --action_env=PYTHONPATH, but that doesn't fix the issue...

body:
I'm running into a very similar problem as reported here, where `import keras_applications` fails during the build of TensorFlow 1.11.0 (cfr. #21518), even though `Keras-Applications` is installed in a location listed in `$PYTHONPATH` (installed with `pip install --prefix`, so not in a standard location).

Testing with `python -c "import keras_applications"` confirms that my environment (outside of the Bazel sandbox) is correctly set up.

Like @maxnbk I have tried instructing Bazel (v0.16.0 in my case) to pass down `$PYTHONPATH` using `--action_env=PYTHONPATH`, but that doesn't fix the issue...

Any updates on this?
